function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of studies on the impact of transportation flows and population density on disease spread","Impact":"Inability to effectively mitigate disease spread in transportation hubs and densely populated areas","Mitigation":"Conduct comprehensive studies to understand the relationship between transportation flows, population density, and disease spread. Implement targeted interventions based on study findings.","Technologies":"Data analytics, epidemiological modeling, simulation tools","People":"General public, travelers, public health officials","Owner":"Public health organizations, government agencies"},{"Description":"Omission of empirical analyses on the relationship between built environment attributes and COVID-19 spread","Impact":"Inadequate understanding of the influence of built environment attributes on disease spread","Mitigation":"Conduct empirical analyses to determine the impact of built environment attributes on the spread of COVID-19. Use findings to inform urban planning and public health policies.","Technologies":"GIS mapping, data analytics, spatial statistics","People":"Urban planners, public health officials, researchers","Owner":"Urban planning departments, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Failure to incorporate location-sensitive effects of built environment attributes in global regression models","Impact":"Inaccurate assessment of the global effects of built environment attributes on disease spread","Mitigation":"Integrate location-sensitive effects of built environment attributes in regression models to provide a more accurate assessment of their impact on disease spread. Validate models with location-specific data.","Technologies":"Statistical modeling, geospatial analysis, machine learning","People":"Policy makers, public health researchers, urban planners","Owner":"Research institutions, policy-making bodies"}]}
